Typical of his attempts to bring mathematics and philosophy together is the paper
Also sprach Ariadne
(1992)
.  Doru Stefanescu writes:-
The author considers various mathematical interpretations of some philosophical texts. He especially dwells on the theory of monades of Leibniz and on the work "Also sprach Zarathustra" of F Nietzsche. His speculative considerations are illustrated by suggestive examples from set theory, mathematical logic, abstract algebra and differential, algebraic and analytic geometry. He considers basic philosophic concepts such as Sein, Schein, monades, transcendental perception, pure reason, Sehkraft, and mathematical objects such as equivalence relations, polynomials, projections. The main thesis of the paper is that
algebraic geometry
is a prolegomenon to a mathematical theory of monades.
